### PR summary [aa2a6ccf0d](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15074/commits/aa2a6ccf0d14d594fac06f58e2c3a87fe052dc53)

`+ mul_add_one_le_add_one_pow`
`+ mul_le_pow`
`+ two_mul_sq_add_one_le_two_pow_two_mul`
<details>

maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.

Anyway LGTM, thanks!

bors d+

:v: pechersky can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

I looked for this limit, or anything like mul_le_pow which would be necessary for it, but couldn't find it. The closest thing I found was Bernoulli's inequality at `one_add_mul_self_lt_rpow_one_add`.

@riccardobrasca would you like me to add the tendsto statement? I can strengthen the exists to say that all n greater than m also satisfy this inequality. I think that statement would need a lemma that would look like a + b < a * b, which I couldn't find either.
I don't have time anymore today, but we can just merge this and add the limit later if we need it. Thanks!

bors r+
